item.description:
Jane Austen: "It is a truth universally acknowledged that a single man of a good fortune must be in want of a wife."

Seth Grahame-Smith:"It is a truth universally acknowledged that a zombie in possession of brains must be in want of more brains."


****************

Perhaps Valentine's Day came and went,and you didn't even bat an eye.
Perhaps you found Jane Austen's incessant old world humor to be a little dry.
Perhaps you are on the quest for a little adventure is just nigh.

Come help us celebrate in true form with a tribute to zombies!

We will pair readings from the original love story, Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice with the new Seth Grahame-Smith's zombiefied version, Pride and Prejudice and Zombies.


Join us for a riveting read-off of the new and old.
And cast a vote for which version of the story should remain the reigning literary classic.


Location Harvard COOP Bookstore, 3rd Floor
item.name: Literary Duel: Pride and Prejudice versus Zombies
